channel.title: CVE Feed for Cloud Foundry -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Cloud Foundry -- all products

item.title: CVE-2020-5417|2024-09-16T17:24:18.560Z -- cloud%20foundry -- capi
item.description: Cloud Foundry CAPI (Cloud Controller), versions prior to 1.97.0, when used in a deployment where an app domain is also the system domain (which is true in the default CF Deployment manifest), were vulnerable to developers maliciously or accidentally claiming certain sensitive routes, potentially resulting in the developer's app handling some requests that were expected to go to certain system components.

item.title: CVE-2020-5401|2024-09-16T17:38:11.499Z -- cloud%20foundry -- routing
item.description: Cloud Foundry Routing Release, versions prior to 0.197.0, contains GoRouter, which allows malicious clients to send invalid headers, causing caching layers to reject subsequent legitimate clients trying to access the app.

item.title: CVE-2018-1262|2024-09-16T17:08:52.142Z -- cloud%20foundry -- cloudfoundry%20uaa
item.description: Cloud Foundry Foundation UAA, versions 4.12.X and 4.13.X, introduced a feature which could allow privilege escalation across identity zones for clients performing offline validation. A zone administrator could configure their zone to issue tokens which impersonate another zone, granting up to admin privileges in the impersonated zone for clients performing offline token validation.

item.title: CVE-2019-3794|2024-09-16T16:28:44.977Z -- cloud%20foundry -- uaa%20release%20%28oss%29
item.description: Cloud Foundry UAA, versions prior to v73.4.0, does not set an X-FRAME-OPTIONS header on various endpoints. A remote user can perform clickjacking attacks on UAA's frontend sites.

item.title: CVE-2019-11293|2024-09-16T17:57:54.838Z -- cloud%20foundry -- uaa%20release
item.description: Cloud Foundry UAA Release, versions prior to v74.10.0, when set to logging level DEBUG, logs client_secret credentials when sent as a query parameter. A remote authenticated malicious user could gain access to user credentials via the uaa.log file if authentication is provided via query parameters.

item.title: CVE-2020-5402|2024-09-16T17:03:33.297Z -- cloud%20foundry -- uaa
item.description: In Cloud Foundry UAA, versions prior to 74.14.0, a CSRF vulnerability exists due to the OAuth2 state parameter not being checked in the callback function when authenticating with external identity providers.

item.title: CVE-2020-5416|2024-09-16T16:53:12.333Z -- cloud%20foundry -- routing
item.description: Cloud Foundry Routing (Gorouter), versions prior to 0.204.0, when used in a deployment with NGINX reverse proxies in front of the Gorouters, is potentially vulnerable to denial-of-service attacks in which an unauthenticated malicious attacker can send specially-crafted HTTP requests that may cause the Gorouters to be dropped from the NGINX backend pool.

item.title: CVE-2018-15754|2024-09-16T17:24:01.117Z -- cloud%20foundry -- uaa%20release
item.description: Cloud Foundry UAA, versions 60 prior to 66.0, contain an authorization logic error. In environments with multiple identity providers that contain accounts across identity providers with the same username, a remote authenticated user with access to one of these accounts may be able to obtain a token for an account of the same username in the other identity provider.

item.title: CVE-2018-11084|2024-09-16T16:49:02.611Z -- cloud%20foundry -- garden-runc
item.description: Cloud Foundry Garden-runC release, versions prior to 1.16.1, prevents deletion of some app environments based on file attributes. A remote authenticated malicious user may create and delete apps with crafted file attributes to cause a denial of service for new app instances or scaling up of existing apps.

item.title: CVE-2024-22279|2024-08-01T22:43:34.216Z -- cloud%20foundry -- routing%20release
item.description: Improper handling of requests in Routing Release > v0.273.0 and <= v0.297.0 allows an unauthenticated attacker to degrade the service availability of the Cloud Foundry deployment if performed at scale.

item.title: CVE-2024-37082|2024-07-12T16:22:02.363Z -- cloud%20foundry -- haproxy-boshrelease
item.description:
When deploying Cloud Foundry together with the haproxy-boshrelease and using a non default configuration, it might be possible to craft HTTP requests that bypass mTLS authentication to Cloud Foundry applications.
You are affected if you have route-services enabled in routing-release and have configured the haproxy-boshrelease property “ha_proxy.forwarded_client_cert” to “forward_only_if_route_service”.

item.title: CVE-2024-22279|2024-06-11T17:23:34.311Z -- cloud%20foundry -- routing%20release
item.description: Improper handling of requests in Routing Release > v0.273.0 and <= v0.297.0 allows an unauthenticated attacker to degrade the service availability of the Cloud Foundry deployment if performed at scale.

item.title: CVE-2024-37082|2024-07-12T15:38:05.256Z -- cloud%20foundry -- haproxy-boshrelease
item.description:
When deploying Cloud Foundry together with the haproxy-boshrelease and using a non default configuration, it might be possible to craft HTTP requests that bypass mTLS authentication to Cloud Foundry applications.
You are affected if you have route-services enabled in routing-release and have configured the haproxy-boshrelease property “ha_proxy.forwarded_client_cert” to “forward_only_if_route_service”.

item.title: CVE-2024-37082|2024-07-17T20:25:39.258Z -- cloud%20foundry -- haproxy-boshrelease
item.description:
When deploying Cloud Foundry together with the haproxy-boshrelease and using a non default configuration, it might be possible to craft HTTP requests that bypass mTLS authentication to Cloud Foundry applications.
You are affected if you have route-services enabled in routing-release and have configured the haproxy-boshrelease property “ha_proxy.forwarded_client_cert” to “forward_only_if_route_service”.

item.title: CVE-2024-37082|2024-08-02T03:43:51.046Z -- cloud%20foundry -- haproxy-boshrelease
item.description:
When deploying Cloud Foundry together with the haproxy-boshrelease and using a non default configuration, it might be possible to craft HTTP requests that bypass mTLS authentication to Cloud Foundry applications.
You are affected if you have route-services enabled in routing-release and have configured the haproxy-boshrelease property “ha_proxy.forwarded_client_cert” to “forward_only_if_route_service”.
